verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%>, A Psalm of David <S%H1732><s%> the servant <S%H5650><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>. The transgression <S%H6588><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> saith <S%H5002><s%> within <S%H7130><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%>, that there is no fear <S%H6343><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> before his eyes <S%H5869><s%>.
For he flattereth <S%H2505><s%> himself in his own eyes <S%H5869><s%>, until his iniquity <S%H5771><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> to be hateful <S%H8130><s%>. until: Heb. to find his iniquity to hate
The words <S%H1697><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> are iniquity <S%H205><s%> and deceit <S%H4820><s%>: he hath left off <S%H2308><s%> to be wise <S%H7919><s%>, and to do good <S%H3190><s%>.

He deviseth <S%H2803><s%> mischief <S%H205><s%> upon his bed <S%H4904><s%>; he setteth <S%H3320><s%> himself in a way <S%H1870><s%> that is not good <S%H2896><s%>; he abhorreth <S%H3988><s%> not evil <S%H7451><s%>. mischief: or, vanity
Thy mercy <S%H2617><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, is in the heavens <S%H8064><s%>; and thy faithfulness <S%H530><s%> reacheth unto the clouds <S%H7834><s%>.

Thy righteousness <S%H6666><s%> is like the great <S%H410><s%> mountains <S%H2042><s%>; thy judgments <S%H4941><s%> are a great <S%H7227><s%> deep <S%H8415><s%>: O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, thou preservest <S%H3467><s%> man <S%H120><s%> and beast <S%H929><s%>. the: Heb. the mountains of God

How excellent <S%H3368><s%> is thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>! therefore the children <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> put their trust <S%H2620><s%> under the shadow <S%H6738><s%> of thy wings <S%H3671><s%>. excellent: Heb. precious

They shall be abundantly satisfied <S%H7301><s%> with the fatness <S%H1880><s%> of thy house <S%H1004><s%>; and thou shalt make them drink <S%H8248><s%> of the river <S%H5158><s%> of thy pleasures <S%H5730><s%>. abundantly: Heb. watered
For with thee is the fountain <S%H4726><s%> of life <S%H2416><s%>: in thy light <S%H216><s%> shall we see <S%H7200><s%> light <S%H216><s%>.

O continue <S%H4900><s%> thy lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%> unto them that know <S%H3045><s%> thee; and thy righteousness <S%H6666><s%> to the upright <S%H3477><s%> in heart <S%H3820><s%>. continue: Heb. draw out at length
Let not the foot <S%H7272><s%> of pride <S%H1346><s%> come <S%H935><s%> against me, and let not the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> remove <S%H5110><s%> me.
There are the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> fallen <S%H5307><s%>: they are cast down <S%H1760><s%>, and shall not be able <S%H3201><s%> to rise <S%H6965><s%>.
